intro: Cardamine basicola, commonly known as the alpine watercress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and rocky slopes. The plant has delicate, trifoliate leaves with a peppery aroma, and its small white flowers are arranged in clusters. Cardamine basicola is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
